message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and their application to segmentation tasks, which are typically addressed in the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also introduces a novel approach to integrating segmentation information within CNNs, which involves modifying the convolution operation using local attention masks. This approach is related to the fields of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), which are concerned with developing algorithms that can learn from data and make intelligent decisions. The paper also discusses the use of the proposed method for semantic segmentation, which involves classifying each pixel in an image according to its semantic category, and for optical flow, which involves estimating the motion of objects in an image. These tasks are relevant to the sub-categories of neural networks (cs.NE) and natural language processing (cs.CL), respectively.
